title: The Ghost Accord
outcome: The reappeared 'ghosts' organize, leveraging their digital invisibility and access to negotiate with Oksana Lintz. In exchange for public testimony about forced erasures and assistance in stabilizing city infrastructure, Lintz offers limited legal protections and a say in future system reforms. The deal destabilizes established Council factions. As details leak, citizens are divided: some see the ghosts as heroes, others as opportunists. The Directorate quietly prepares measures to monitor the ghosts despite their protected status, deepening the split among leadership.

events.description: Lintz and Kova initiate covert meetings with ghost representatives. Initial demands focus on public acknowledgment of erasure and protected status.
News leaks of secret talks between Council members and ghosts. Protests erupt as citizens argue over the legitimacy and privilege of the returned individuals.
Ghosts agree to testify about forced disappearances in exchange for legal immunity and influence over future system reforms. Directorate registers strong opposition.
First public testimony from ghosts airs on city broadcasts, recounting life after erasure. Council factions descend into open conflict, each blaming the other for systemic abuses.
The Directorate quietly deploys new tracking measures targeting ghosts, despite legal protection agreements. Trust in the Council fractures further.
